Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: MrTall_99
Reviews.Content: Just back from 2 days stay at this hotel. They put me in a nice room due to priority club level, spacious , comfortable uk and European power sockets were a nice bonus. Bathroom was great with a jacuzzi bath. Room 630 if you're interested. People were very friendly but always tried to take my hand luggage which I hate :( Hotel isn't central but 15 min taxi ride has you at the spice markets (20 lira) and the big bonus is a great little gym that locals use, sauna and steam room and Turkish bath where I had soap, scrub massage for 100 lira. Will definitely stay again next time I'm in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A usual Holiday Inn experience”
Reviews.Author: Kostiantyn
Reviews.Content: It's almost the same at any HI place. Standard rooms, standard beds, standard smiles, standard price. A value-for money in Istanbul as it takes 4 or 5 modern tram stops to take to Sultanahmet area without hefty price of centrally located Istanbul hotels. Quite new property, no obvious signs of wear and tear A wise choice for 1-2 nights, for a prolonged stay or vacation choose another place.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Heather S
Reviews.Content: We went for a week 13th to 18th feb 2012 with friends as my hubbies 6oth. The staff were lovely, room could have been better, our friends were upgraded free of charge because of the points he had.(business) so we asked if we could upgrade but were told it would cost Â£200. per night for a suite. that was an extra Â£1200 for the 6 nights and that did not include any food even breakfast. We found ourselves in a hotel which was full of turkish prodomiately male walking injured, we were told they stayed there while having treatment at the local hospital. We felt totally out of place and found it difficult to relax, they completely took over the lounge area, it was uncomfortable to sit and have a drink as we were "on show" We all agreed if we had known about this before hand, we would not stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Its almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: lahoree
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed from Jan 31st to Feb 4th as mentioned by other reviewers, the Hotel is litrelly next to Pazateke stop of T1 line and T1 line is the one which will take you to most of the tourist places. We were got into Istanbul late at night, toke the Metro to the hotel checked inn, they made copies of our passports, gave us a brief description of the area and and away we went, our room was on the third floor, despite it being next to the elevator, there was no noise, we were however in the annex section. Our room was well equipped, with the exception of an Iron, which I am finding out is common thing in European hotels. The size of the room was good by European Standards, room had a view of the pool and the patio. One very important thing, while taking a shower make sure to give your self some room to move around, as the water temperature will jump up to the tune of 20-30 degree without any reason for brief moments, if you are not careful you could hurt yourself trying to get away from the water. while this seems trivial, it really isn't, The Internet went out one night at 4:00AM the staff came up quickly and fixed/resat and check with us to make sure it was running once again. kudos to the staff. The lobby had plenty of comfortable spaces to sit and lounge as well as two computers (which were almost always occupied) to surf the internet. The cafe in the lounge was expensive 25 Lira for coffee and a scone. Overall I was very happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great start to 2012”
Reviews.Author: copleycop
Reviews.Content: We checked in NYE and used the tram to get to the Holiday Inn from Ataturk (Havalimani) to Pazartekke, bargain journey at 4 TL each. Hotel is right outside the stop. Check in was friendly and helpful even though it was busy with NYE preparations in the hotel. We used our points for the stay and was upgraded to a suite. This had the WOW factor and it was easily one of the best rooms we've stayed in for a while for comfort and style. The hotel grounds and interior are also high quality and better than the general holiday inn's I've stayed in elsewhere worldwide. Everything from beginning to end was excellent and all the staff members were friendly and helpful. Hotel is just inside the old city walls. So you'll need to travel round a bit to see all the sights but there are plenty trams, buses and dolmus/taxis around and you can always walk, we did.. Istanbul is that big and so much to see you'd be daft to think there is one area that is better than another for hotels. Give this hotel a go, you'll be happy you did.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad location”
Reviews.Author: docrick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we wanted a hotel with a pool. Though it's a shame we could not use it on 2 out of the days we were there. The hotel uses the pool area for functions. Which is interesting for the first time but when they keep playing loud music till late and is on 2 nights in a row it becomes a nuisance. We were upgraded to a suite, no apparent reason. We welcomed it. The suite was big and some funky lights They had a barbecue brunch which was amazing but then cancelled the barbeque dinner with no notice. The reason another function. Location is a bit away from the tourist sites but there is a direct tram. Which can get crowded in the evenings A good size gym. We tried the hammam which was excellent. Check out chimurat a local restaurant close by.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SRPURI
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Istanbul city is a comfortable hotel to stay in. The bets thing is that there is a tram station right opposite the hotel and you can be in Sultanahmet in 15 minutes. The staff is extremely friendly and do all they can to make your stay as comfortable as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaraswathiLaxman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there between Oct 22-25, 2011. We had read some reviews about smoke smell in the room and were concerned as we are both non-smokers. We had the most outstanding holiday. the hotel was great. right outside the hotel is the tram stop - Pazartekke. The rooms are clean and decent sized. The breakfast spread is wide and varied. I am a vegetarian and both my husband and I had enough and more of both choices.

Reviews.Title: “Room Thermostats do not function”
Reviews.Author: Jon S
Reviews.Content: I was with a group that stayed Holiday Inn Istanbul City in October 2011. The location was nice and services were also nice. However, the room had a thermostat â€“ supposedly to adjust the temperature, that did not function. Another member of our group had the same problem. She was from Florida and wanted the temperature higher. Her room stayed at 19 C â€“ the thermostat did nothing. I am from Oregon and wanted the temperature lower. My room stayed at 25 C and again the thermostat did nothing. (Neither of us realized the other had a problem until we were leaving!) We both told the desk about the problem and were told it would be â€˜looked intoâ€™. There was no change for the next two nights. The room thermostats at this hotel seem to be decorative, not functional. As a result I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent accommodation, decent food, decent service”
Reviews.Author: berkoboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the International Health Tourism Congress. Only issue was the hassle with getting a cable for internet access in the rooms. Otherwise a pretty good hotel for business and vacation use and only 20 minutes or so from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Location and room ok, Wifi did not work in room”
Reviews.Author: singinggigi
Reviews.Content: I was on a package tour and this hotel was the chosen hotel for the first 2 nights we spent in Istanbul. The hotel is located close to part of the old city wall in the old town area of Istanbul. It took 20 minutes ( one way) to reach the major sights (Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya etc). Everything in the room worked. I had a room with a queen bed. Bathroom was furnished typical Holiday Inn style. Unfortunately wi fi did not work in my room at all. I had to take the computer out in the corridor in order to go online. Elevators are very small ( Maximum 5 tp 6 people per car with no luggage). Breakfast was buffet style with the standards (eggs, bread, fruit, olives, cheese, sausages, omelets, tea and coffee) served. Overall, the hotel is ok for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but...”
Reviews.Author: ebookpunkie
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located and you can easily get into town. Nice turkish bath But staff is surly, unhelpfull and not a credit to IHG Better to spend a bit more money and stay in the Intercontinental with a Bosphorous view.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, helpful staff, and not a bad location.”
Reviews.Author: Andrea E
Reviews.Content: I'm a Platinum member with Priority Club so I've stayed in a ton of their hotels. I have nothing but great things to say about this hotel. I've stayed here twice and been given an upgrade to a suite both times. Everyone is friendly and I have always been able to find someone that speaks fluent English. Â Sener Soylu was great to work with. I recommend working with her with any issues.Â

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL IN QUITE LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Mahth
Reviews.Content: i stayed threee nights with my wife on a honey moon trip ! i loved this hotel alot , a very friendly staff at reception ... helping staff

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what was expected”
Reviews.Author: Dai_&_Julie_Jones
Reviews.Content: Having been transferred by coach along a very convoluted route we worried about access to the sites but, as others have pointed out, there was a tram stop outside the front door. We purchased "jetons" for 2 lira each from the machine on the platform and were able to travel directly in to all the sights we wanted to see. The hotel was standard Holiday Inn style. Room was more than adequate. Breakfast was good. Our only complaint was the lack of any decaf hot drinks though we WERE prepared for this and took our own tea bags and instant coffee sachets. The pool looked lovely but we were too busy visiting tourist attractions to make use of it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sophiacheremlopes12
Reviews.Content: The staff gives you the impression they are there for you all the time and very cordially.

Reviews.Title: “Good for price”
Reviews.Author: TheMcs
Reviews.Content: We stayed using our points with our kids and they gave us an upgrade to a suite which was huge if not a bit dated in style. I think it had been recently renovated but the style was quite eighties and I think they may have not replaced the carpets, because as other people said the rooms do smell of smoke and the carpets are very dated in style but do look clean. The pool area was pleasant, but the water was freezing, I wasn't brave enough to enter, but the kids did. The new restaurant was nice and breakfast was good. The service was very good in all ways particularly the reception staff who were very helpful. Trams stop outside the hotel making it very easy to access all the sights of Istanbul. The receptionist explained how to buy tickets and gave us tram maps etc. They are packed though, but totally managable.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but it smells like smoke in all the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Frugby1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nicely located, close to the downtown Istambul, and 15 min away with the train from all the historical monument. Breakfast and dinner, was ok, nothing special There is nice swimming pool in the center of the hotel I booked a none smoking room... I changed 3 times rooms, and everytime, they stunk all like smoke....the reception told me that they could not do anything...

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but late and loud nights”
Reviews.Author: TBO8
Reviews.Content: The good - the hotel has parking, is on the tram line (although at least 9 stops from Sultanahmet so leave 30 minutes early if you are heading to the tourist sites there), and the rooms were nice. We had a suite and it easily could sleep 5 people with room to spare. The bad, we stayed 4 nights and 2 of the nights the hotel booked events poolside that included loud music late into the night making it nearly impossible to sleep. With half the rooms looking directly on pool I don't know why they would allow this, but the hotel was fully booked and grabbing the extra revenue from the events.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the genuine hospitality having stayed here twice in the last 2 years”
Reviews.Author: AbuDhabiWil
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located at Topkapi and 2min walk from the Topkapi Metro, we chose this hotel because of its excellent price and 15min subway ride to down town and Sultanahmet-Old City. Saves you time and money by taking the subway from Atarturk Airport to the hotel. Great variety of local bars and cafes 3 blocks down - great way to start your day with breakfast at the local bakery or end one with Efes Beer with the locals! We were in Istanbul on three occasions in 2010 and on all visits chose this hotel. The suites were very spacious and comfortable. We recalled spending a lazy afternoon watching TV and dozing off together at the couch. There is even one suite with disco lights mounted to the ceiling, very amusing. The gift shop sells very unique articles and even after shopping at the Grand Bazaar for the past days, we were still buying from this store. Nice looking pool but unfortunately winter chills didnt permit us to experience it. Great hotel for any discerning traveller!

Reviews.Title: “Surprising modernist hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Maggie C
Reviews.Content: This hotel surprised us all considering that we were not in the Barcelo Eresin Istanbul across the street where other groups with our tour company were often lodged. But this Holiday Inn gave us a very comfortable room which included a spacious sitting area with a couch and a very nice bathroom. The breakfast was good as well as plentiful. The public areas were comfortable although the drinks in the bar were expensive-$15 for a gin and tonic. But the biggest surprise was that the restaurant was excellent. We had dinner there on our last night being too tired to go forth and hunt for someplace. The food was imaginatively presented (read beautiful to look at) and excellent to taste. I was sorry I wasn't more hungry because I could have eaten some more of what they were serving. The hotel didn't seem to present its restaurant as a special place for dinner, but I would definitely stay there again just to eat there. And I say this as a certified California "foodie." Mind you, not cheap but worth every penny spent. Another grand thing about the hotel was that it was across the street from a tram stop where for a few lira you could go straight in to the historic district of old Istanbul and then catch the tram "home" at the end of the day without having to worry about changing trams or getting lost. It is hard to miss the tram stop at Haiga Sofia in the heart of the historic district. I suspect the hotel is a little cheaper than the Barcelo Eresin Istanbul, a more historic and old world style hotel across the street and from my point of view you would get good value for your money spent at the Holiday Inn Istanbul. I didn't try it but they seemed to have an extensive spa treatment facility in the hotel as well as a nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “Will be staying again, when I'm back in Istanbul later in the year”
Reviews.Author: djg2018
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel; rooms are comfortable and well appointed though maybe small compared to Holiday Inn in North America. Standard of housekeeping was excellent, with the room and public areas very clean. I found the hotel staff in general to be efficient , polite and helpful - all reception and restaurant staff spoke good English. I'd definitely recommend taking breakfast as the range and quality of the food was of a very high standard; even at the busy breakfast period the staff ensured that tables were kept clear (no need to wait to be seated) , and that the buffet was kept well stocked Although not located in the historic city, or the commercial district ( Taksim square) , the tram runs on the street outside so these areas are all within very easy to reach ( as is the airport, as the tram connects also with the metro line) - the good public transport compensates for the hotel's out of centre location. All in all though, this hotel works out less expensive than corresponding hotels in the centre, so is good choice if you're happy with the tram ride - I will certainly come back

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thair_1970
Reviews.Content: Hi, I am a frequent traveler to Istanbul, it was my first stay in this hotel and simply it was the best, the location is very good just opposite to the metro station, all the attractions are nearby and shops are there running until 2 am. Check in was easy I booked 2 rooms at arrival we were assigned in different floors but when I told the front desk that we have kids and we cant leave them alone they managed to allocate us in the same floor, one of the rooms were a suite with sitting room, huge LCD TV, and a JACUZZI!!!! Rooms always clean, breakfast was rich and fresh, staff very helpful and smiling (rare in Turkey). The window was looking at the pool were weddings took place 3 nights during my 5 days stay but it was a lot of fun for us and the kids to watch it. I highly recommend it as reasonably priced nice hotel. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “A rare, positive surprise”
Reviews.Author: ofy
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveller you donâ€™t usually get surprised about hotels. Usually you can set expectations if you use a.o. TripAdvisor. Your stay might not be fantastic, but who cares if you have prepared for that. My stay at Holiday Inn City in Istanbul became one of the major - positive - surprises for years. In fact I only went there because my usual hotel was sold out, but it will not become last time. I may have been lucky with regards to the room. But I donâ€™t think I was just lucky in terms of the attitude and the quality I met among the staff. Friendly. Helpful. Professional. A nice neighbourhood if you like Turkey. Fine restaurant - breakfast as well as dinner. Same experience in other services (pool, massage, shuttle). Iâ€™m impressed !

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rest average”
Reviews.Author: OSNT-DXB
Reviews.Content: I go to Istanbul for business regularly and this is one of my plan B options if Holiday Inn Airport is full. Officially it's 5*, but i would rather give it 3*. It's not fancy at all but a decent place, but compared to the other 2 Holiday Inns in Istanbul (Airport, Sisli) operated by another franchisee it's worlds apart. The location is good though, there's a tram stop right in front of the hotel and in 15 min you are in Sultanahmed, and a few min later at Galata bridge. Internet is free, at least for me as an Priority Club Gold card holder, for others I don't know.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cultural location”
Reviews.Author: dallassutter
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean Holiday Inn type. Outdoor pool is a must in summer and nice prices. cons: far from touristic places but the gem of it is hotel is situated out of tourist and you have opportunity to walk around hotel and you could fine a small square around Buyuk Saray Mereydani Cd street and Yunus Emre Sk with all the coffee shops street markets, bred shops, etc Turkish culture can offer in its everyday life.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic General Manager, Ms. EVREN TOLGAY”
Reviews.Author: barb2801
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Hotel and were greatly impressed by the friendly and accommocating staff. The Hotel is well located close to the tram which takes one to the major sight seeing attractions ---Topaki Palace, Hagi Sofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, and Spice Market. Unfortunatly the day before leaving for home, my husband's wallet was "pick pocketed". Ms. Tolgay, General Manager, was extremely helpful and offered to do everything possible to be of assistance - including loaning us money! Fortunately we were OK $$$ wise, but we greatly appreciated her offers of help and consideration for our plight. We're happy to report that because we immediately notified our credit card companies, we were not held responsible for the $50,000. of charges made to our cards within an hour of them being stolen!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, great location, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: woodley188
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed here in may this year for 5 nights to attend the Istanbul F1 and to to tour the city, on arrival we were upgraded to a suite which was very kind of them and was a very nice room, spacious, clean , everything you need. The staff were very helpful and answered all our questions easily and with a smile ! The hotel is in our opinion in a great location out of the city, opposite a mainline tram station, ( Pazartekke ) and takes 15/20 mins to get in to the main square of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING STAY”
Reviews.Author: Atef220
Reviews.Content: - I just back yesterday from Istanbul, and i stayed in Holiday Inn Istanbul and it was really AMAZING, as a platinum priority club member they upgraded my room to a suit (which is really big and nice decoration), and internet was free of charge, Also check-in process was very smooth - The tram station in the front of the door and just 15-20 min. to reach to Sultanahmed area - Carrefour Express in front of hotel, and also 24 hrs shop in the gas station in front of hotel - The hotel is very close to Panorama 1453 (about 300 meters) - Only 2 tram station to Findekzade (Friday Pazar) - Staff were very helpful and friendly Finally, I really liked the hotel and i would go there again in my next trip to Istanbul because they really made my vacation better. Thank You

Reviews.Title: “The level of ordinariness rises steadily....”
Reviews.Author: BarrigntonIsTops
Reviews.Content: The good bits first: the rooms are clean, the facilities and decor are modern and transport is right at your door. The internet was fast and, best of all, it was free (as it should be but is rarely). The staff were welcoming and universally terrific, Engin on reception particularly sticks in my mind as going above and beyond. For example, when we arrived we realised our room was overloking the busy street and was noisy. A complaint and we were reassigned a room at the back of the hotel without quibble. The bad bits: the rooms are frighteningly small, the neighbourhood not terrific. It is not well located for restaurants. Ask for a back room as the ones on the street are noisy. If you are after the quintessential Istanbul holiday experience, look elsewhere. If you are in Istanbul on business, the Holiday Inn might be a good choice. Interesting mix of guests from all over the world on display in the restaurant at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean and nice.”
Reviews.Author: Saurabhkedia
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. neat, clean and well kept, although pretty smallish. has a joke for a pool. but good staff, the spa seemed nice, although we didnt use it. well connected with the tram line. the tram station right opposite the hotel gate. A supermarket just opposite the hotel also very handy. But as a tourist you need to take the tram and go to all the main locations. this is a drawback. We were upgraded to the suite, so the experience was quite good. dont know how the normal rooms are.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 3*”
Reviews.Author: jackpalance
Reviews.Content: Just returned from city break. Wonderful city & good hotel, we went as part of a deal which was terrific value for money Inc. club flights! But I'm sure that you would not want to pay rack rates (does anyone)? Two weddings but no noise or problems, breakfast good no bacon of course, staff very helpful and courteous. Just think of this hotel as a very good 3* never a 5* except the prices! For 5* try the Barcelo over the road.

Reviews.Title: “Rather than a chain experience, this hotel provided cultural enrichment!”
Reviews.Author: Historian37
Reviews.Content: The courtyard which the hotel surrounds was the place for two major cultural celebrations while we were there. Tables set with fine crystal and candelabra and flowers, a large bouquet floating in the pool, and a large throne facing the pool were the setting for a circumcision festival honoring a 10-12 year old boy. It looked like a wedding reception! The very next night there was a wedding reception, complete with Barbie-like bride and handsome groom. We felt like we had arrived in a different culture--and we had! The rooms were comfortable and well-appointed. A lovely place to stay. Some in our group enjoyed the spa services as well.

Reviews.Title: “not the service expected for a holiday inn”
Reviews.Author: litaUk
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel to be informed that there had been a burst pipe and all of our floor had been flooded. However they had alternative accommodation at another hotel for one night. As compensation they offered us a free meal in the hotel restaurant. We were disappointed but agreed. We got carted half way across town and taken to a flea pit of a hotel. We promptly refused to stay and demanded to be taken back to the hotel. I informed the guy at reception I was not budging and told him I knew he was lying about the flood. They had actually overbooked we found out from a member of staff. I demanded our rooms that we had had booked three months ago. To cut a long story short they got us a room and extra beds for the first night and then for the next 2 they got us the 2 rooms we had booked. We did get our free meal and wine in the restaurant, but to be honest wish we hadnt bothered. The meal was terrible. Our appetisers arrived after the main, the food was cold and the service was terrible. After we had drunk our free bottle of wine we ordered extra and agreed we would pay for the next bottle. The brought an opened bottle to our table with a glass already out of it, and wanted us to pay for a full bottle! There was a wedding on in the hotel every night we were there. It is obviously very popular with locals and they are keen to keep them happy, which is understandable however guests cannot use the pool as the wedding is set around the pool. Not ideal as we were on a girlie weekend and a pool was part of the plan to spend some time there, along with time in the spa. The spa looked nice but only provided massages. We were expecting to have some beauty treatments. Maybe we should have checked first. The hotel itself was clean and the tram stop outside was a great way to get into town, however I would like to point out to ladies that the trams are very full. I mean very FULL. No seating room. One of us girls had a not very pleasant experience with a man deliberately pushing into her in a very sexual manner. She was basically trapped and could'nt move an inch. It was very distressing for her so watch out!

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: howsocks
Reviews.Content: the hotel is not as you woul expect a five star to be.After asking 4 times the kettle in my rom was not replaced with one that worked. I was late checking in, the hotel staff did not inform the person I was meeting until 3 hours after I was supposed to meet them that I would be late. The staff gave the impression of being both helpful and efficient however this was a bit hit and miss in terms of delivery but appologised profusely for errors, which were still not rectified. Hotel very clean though, and the city was fabulous and well worth a second visit..

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not for the business minded traveler”
Reviews.Author: PhDRN
Reviews.Content: This is a not bad Holiday Inn and if you are looking for or don't mind staying in a hotel that looks like every other business hotel in the world, this is your place. It is clean, well appointed, on the trolley line and a quick commute to the airport. But it is out in the suburbs and nowhere near the old parts of Istanbul. Staff are helpful. Food is adequate (mostly buffet style) but the same every day. The internet service is pretty poor whether accessing using the (Turkish Language) hotel "business" computers or trying to access the wireless. Internet service is not free but costs about 10 TL/24 hours. And beware- that nice welcome basket with the wine and the mineral water in your room is VERY pricey. You can go across the street to the Shell Service STation Mart and get the same items for 1/4 the price. Also, this hotel caters to large parties and tours - If you stay in the new wing, you will hear the party music way into the night. Ask for a street side room in the original wing- double glazed windows and the fan block out the street noise well and the room will be quiet and away from the party noise. This is an adequate hotel if you want a westernized place to stay-wish I could have stayed in one of the little old hotels in the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Burak is the best”
Reviews.Author: omwassila
Reviews.Content: At first we arrive at 7 :30 am I have 3 kids (8;5;2 years)with me they were traveling over night didnot sleep for almost 8 hours; they told us they cannot give us the room before 2:00 pm !!!!! they were very unhelpful one "youssef" was very unhelpful and show no concern also the woman " handi" she was unhelpful and doesnot care ; except only one of them his name is "burak "he was vey very nice and show alot of concern until he gave us a connected rooms for me and my family; Thank you "Burak".......

Reviews.Title: “Most underrated hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: tauysal
Reviews.Content: For the price, this hotel provides a lot more than one would expect. My family was upgraded to a spacious suite with free internet overlooking the pool. The location is somewhat out of the way but the subway station is a short walk from the hotel. Within 20 minutes we were at the heart of Istanbul. The hotel has a beatiful pool and gym. The restaurant looked very nice too but we never ate there as we had made arrangements at other restaurants. We had a very comfortable 3 night stay and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location To Reach Everywhere In Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Maherthebest
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with a group of family and I found out that this hotel is an exact 4* Luxe Hotel, not less & not more, if you were stricted to accomodate in 5* hotels then it is better for you to look somewhere else... Let me say what is important to be mentioned : *- A great place to reach everywhere in Istanbul, being located directly to the tramway station of "Pazartekke" giving you the chance to transfer very smoothly just from front of the hotel to city center ( Grand Bazar, Sultanahmet, Eminounu, reaching KabataÅŸ ) if you take the tram going to the right direction of hotel gate, and to reach Zeytinburunu and Ataturk airport if you take the tram going toward the left direction of hotel ( you can obtain "jetons" the coins for riding the tram just from the kiosk right to the hotel gate ... shortly you can go and return very simply from and to this hotel, say bye to Istanbul expensive taxis. *- the hotel is quite calm, dont believe who says the opposite. *- Most rooms have a reasonable view to the city, only few rooms in the back side have view to other old buildings and ugly roofs. *- The fitness center and the turkish bath were great. *- The rooms were neated and cleaned every day, dont get surprised if your room door was opened at the early morning ( 08:00 am ) by room service even if you were sleeping inside willing to clean it, they will just say sorry !, anyway, you have to put the used towels on bath floor otherwise they will not be changed. *-Breakfast at the hotel was great, the variety ot the open buffet was well but you will get bored when you will find exactly the same breakfast after staying more than 3 nights. *-You will have to ask for the daily internet password to access the net at the reception, and wireless access was obviously not covering all parts of the hotel, that what I noticed as we were a group of 10 persons staying at different located rooms in different flats *-The reception staff was great specially Mr. Engin, he was very helpful and kind guy. *-Swimming pool is verrrrry clean, but I didnt use in March, however I cant remeber if I found other entertainment suitable for kids at that hotel. One thing I was not sure about, at sometimes I understood that hotel services such as " Turkish Bath, Fitness center, Internet access " were NOT free but it seemed that because we had IHG previlage club card we were granted all these services for free. All in all, if you stayed at holiday inn istanbul city hotel, you will get the value of your money and I believe it will be better than many other hotels I have tried in Istanbul had the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Just a 1 star motel,lobby 3.5 star”
Reviews.Author: marknorth2010
Reviews.Content: no A/C in hall way, hallway carpet all wrinkled, cleaning staff have very bad body odor, across from a mosque, loud speakers will wake you up at 10:45pm, 4:45Am, so you can not sleep early or wake up late, blinds have no black out lining, A/C in room is very ineffective, the room is wet, carpet have fleas, I have to put lots of plastic bags on the floor to prevent the fleas from eating me. Staffs are very rude, the window was broken and yet refused twice to give me another room. Beware of fraudulent bills upon check out, as some one charged their drinks to my room. I have to audit the signatures and so on before they agree to remove it. Could this be a habit? Now do you ever wander how they got their 5 star? I have heard that corruption is a problem in Turkey? Is you are looking for a 5 star hotel go to Conrad Hotel. Also Be careful when you are sitting on the toilet as it's not supported on the floor , but on the wall, and it can crack. That's what happen to a friend of mine at another hotel and was ordered to pay -up in front of M-16 Rifle-touting policemen .Beware that Turkish can be quite rough, so I save my complains till We come back home safely. Now Istanbul anyone? 5 Star --It's is totally unacceptable.????

Reviews.Title: “Not for a relaxing trip.”
Reviews.Author: 2teachersoutthere
Reviews.Content: We just came home from a week in Istanbul. We booked this hotel because we thought it would be ideal to combine city-tripping and relaxing by the pool. Not so... This hotel organises big wedding parties EVERY Friday, Saturdag and Sunday (so we were told by the staff). This means that: (1) the pool and terrace area is closed for hotel guests at 17:30; (2) loud music is played until midnight, making it impossible for hotel guests to relax in their rooms -even though the windows are soundproof otherwise. On Tuesdag the pool was closed the whole day. Hotel staff was understanding to our complaints, but there was nothing they could do. Our written complaint to the hotel management got no reply. Positive with this hotel is that: - rooms are confortable, beds are good, - hotel staff is very friendly and helping, - it is easily accessed by public transport. I would recommend everyone to ask for detailed information on the opening hours of the pool area before booking: it is frustrating to come to the hotel after a day in town and find out that there's nothing much to do than shower and go back in town again...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel with very convenient tram access”
Reviews.Author: LynnHerrick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and thoroughly enjoyed our time here. The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating and the room was lovely (jacuzzi in the bathroom a big plus :-) The hotel has excellent right-across-the-road tram access to Sultanahmet and beyond and the pool and poolside service were an excellent respite after a day of sightseeing or tackling the Grand Bazaar!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: akef
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. Overall, we had a good stay there. First of all, we are allowed to check in around 10.00am. After an 11 hrs of flight, what we need is a quick bath and rest, and that was what we had. Very near to the Pazartekke Tram station, so, its very convenience for us to travel by tram. To get to the grand bazaar, just hop on the tram pay 1.50 lira, and by 15 minutes, you are there. Room is clean and neat, air condition is good, no bad odour, probably because we chose a non smoking room, room has a nice view, facing pool, very quiet and cozy. The hotel is near to a mosque, so we had no problem of waiting the prayers time. The only slack that we experience was we had to renew the internet access everyday since the password expires at 6pm daily. But, u just need to call the reception and they will deliver it to you shortly. The reception was humble and attentive. checking in and out was done in no hassle. Another thing is the pay tv channel we had to pay for 19 turkish lira. bit expensive. Anyhow, its a good experience and I definitely will stay here should i come to Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice building but needs more”
Reviews.Author: telerian
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 8 nights with my wife and kids and here is my review: Location: Just in front of the tram station that will take you to all the historical location in a 10-15 minutes, lots of nearby supermarkets, fresh fruit sellers, local food. Rooms: A bit small if you have kids ( older than 3 years ), I didnt like housekeeping as they missed putting soap in the bathroom everyday and I had to call to get soap and it took around 30 minutes. Also the complimentary coffee and tea were never filled unless you call and ask for it In general the hotel is good (recently renovated), very quite inside the rooms but they have most of the channels in languages other than English Wireless Internet access was not so good, a bit slow

Reviews.Title: “This was a very nice week in Istambul in Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Tsyatochka
Reviews.Content: We've chosen this hotel because it has a pool (unlike 99% of hotels in this area) and it situates in a very quiet place. One minute to a tram that can take you to any place of interest was very convenient. If you need Internet connection in your room - you can become a member of their club and use it for free. If we visit Stambul again we'll take this Holiday Inn for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Close to public transport in a reasonably quiet area”
Reviews.Author: nathan_black
Reviews.Content: Was here for 12 days for a conference located in the hotel. The hotel is a fair distance from the main sights but the tram being just outside the door makes this not a problem. Room was compact but adequate for just me. The fitness centre was very good. Well equipped with good facilities. As it's connected to their spa facility, you can relax in the hamam after a workout! Pool was good too but not that big if someones already doing laps in it. As mentioned by others, the food was ok but on the expensive side. Ok to grab a quick club sandwich, but Istanbul has much better restaurants around. Same with the minibar - most expensive water around! Internet is free for Priority Club members. I was already a member but it'd be worth joining just for that, as it's 10 euros otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “it was a good deal”
Reviews.Author: davigo
Reviews.Content: We did stay just 2 nights and it was ok. The room was clean and not too noisy even if it was facing the main street. The only problem was the air condition.... there is no way to control the temperature it was 22Â°C and i wasn't able to change it. We got a special price booking online on the hotel website so it was a good deal but i guess if you will pay the full price it's overpriced. We did pay like 60 euros per night. I would say its between 3 and 4 stars but it's not a 5 stars hotel. The tram is just in front of the hotel so you dont need taxi to the center or the airport.

Reviews.Title: “small room, bad air condition, not a touristy location”
Reviews.Author: vaparsi
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 nights at this hotel during June 2010. The standard room which we had is pretty small for 2 people. Tried upgrading to a suite but they were asking for additional 170 Euros which was not worth it. The air condition is central and cannot be changed, We had couple of sleepless nights because of heat. Tried leaving the window open but street noise was too much. The bathroom was a bit moldy with old faucets. After couple of days we managed to change room to a different section of the hotel. The bathroom was a lot cleaner. We had no view but at least there was no street noise. The swimming pool is fairly basic. The exercise room is good but it gets too hot there also. We didn't bother trying the Turkish bath or the sauna because of all the heat we were getting. The food is good but a bit pricey. The hotel is located near the tram station but not close to any attractions. You get free internet when you join their priority club. At best this is a 3 star hotel, assuming you get one of their upgraded rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and neat place”
Reviews.Author: fern685
Reviews.Content: The hotel we stayed in was good , nice and clean . The front desk was kind enough to provide us informtion as and when needed . The turkish bath was an experience to remember . The breakfast buffet could do with a bit more variety. The tram service is located right next to the hotel and you can reach the city in 20 min (but avoid the rush hour ). lot of eateries and supermarkets next to the hotel . while booking please specify smoking or non smoking room . overall a good experience

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel on busy road between city center and Airport”
Reviews.Author: QualitePrix
Reviews.Content: Booked through Hotwire. Not much saving in comparison with having dealt with Expedia or directly with hotel, and inferior quality to what Hotwire website suggested. The staff at the reception upon arrival were unpolite: they asked to see and photocopy the ID of a friend who picked me up from the airport and was accompanying me to my room, as they apparently suspected he would sleep there without paying. Also insisted I use the bellboy although I had a small luggage on wheels. Was placed in a room just beside the elevator door, so that I had to sleep with earplugs. The hotel was fine for a 3 star or 3.5 because of spa and pool but by no stretch of the imagination a 4.5 in terms of room and bathroom luxury. It's located on a busy, dusty 'highway' with a lot of high speed trafic. There is a tram stop in front of the hotel, which is a redeeming factor in that you can travel to the Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sophia, etc. and it's not expensive. However if you want to be in a nice neighbourhood, and have access to a terrace with a view of the city and the sea, look elswhere. This hotel, though standard Holiday Inn, will not add any charm to your Istanbul experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: FadiF75
Reviews.Content: My Istanbul Experience started with an email exchange with the Front desk of Holiday Inn about reservations of a certain event. I got an almost immediate response, with a confirmation number. The receptionist "Senim" was there when I checked in. Same excellent courtesy and speed. The hotel is spotless. Ideal location on the tram, and a gas station shop to fill up on Juice, water etc. across the street. Easy access from Ataturk Airport by Train (Zeitinburnu, then switch to Tram), something like 30 minutes. Very easy access to Sultanahmet (but avoid the rush hours, when the tram is crammed, but that's not the hotel's fault). Beds were comfortable, room service prompt and food good. I will stay there again and again during my next visits to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “a complete let down”
Reviews.Author: appy28
Reviews.Content: we were here for 6 nights and theyve been the most sleepless nights we've had. the entire hotel has a central heating / ac system with no individual settings in any rooms. the rooms were suffocating at night . we were told the entire hotel was on the heater system, ( we were 3 persons and had booked 2 rooms ) and in spite of complaining, the management did nothing whatsoever. as a result, we had to sleep with an open window, with high street noise levels, even at night and bright light coming in at 530am. the tables at breakfast time were dirty with unattended coffee cups and used dishes..to say nothing of dropped leftovers on the floor. the staff at reception, with the exemption of two ladies were cold, brusque, just short of rude. the crowning glory was when i found some of my makeup missing and some damaged, the day we were to check out. after bringing this to their notice...( heard extremely nonchalantely ) i was told to repeat this to a staff member. the usual 'we are so sorry..' statements were made....the end result....ABSOLUTELY NOTHING was done. this has been the sorriest and most dour place we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a quiet part of town with easy transport links for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: saraMacclesfield
Reviews.Content: The location may seem a bit out of town, but it was actually a great base for sightseeing. The tram stop is right outside the hotel, which takes you to the main centre in 15-20 minutes - you can go straight to wherever you are headed as there are tram stops near all the key sites. It is also really easy to get here from the airport using the metro & tram (both 1.5TL, about E0.75 for any length of trip). There are also many restaurants & cafes within a 10 minute walk - just turn right out of the hotel & you'll soon be in the bustling local area of Capa, as well as cafes & restaurants there are many local shops & a few supermarkets which should cater for your every need. There are also a few cafes & a supermarket in the side road opposite the hotel. Nearer still is a kiosk (20 yards from the hotel) selling tokens for the tram as well as drinks & snacks. The hotel itself is great - we were lucky enough to be upgraded to a newly refurbished suite, which was lovely, with a large & functional bathroom. The only surprising aspect was the coloured flashing "disco lighting" feature, which was completely out of place in the calm spa style decor of the room! It was fairly quiet in the room, and we slept very well. The public areas are clean & bright, and the area around the outdoor pool looks inviting (it was too cold to use the pool in March). The highlight is the spa; as a resident you can use the sauna, steam room and Turkish bath. Unusually (for Turkey) these are all mixed, but the attendants will explain the protocol to you and provide towels, slippers and a pestemal (a cloth which you wear all the time to preserve your modesty). There is also a jacuzzi, gym and various massage treatments available for a (relatively high) charge. The downside - the prices for the bar, restaurant and room service are very high, but I suppose this is what you might expect in a 5* hotel in a major city. You don't have to use these services as there are plenty of alternatives nearby. Internet access is free for Priority Club members.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday with a perfect bathroom”
Reviews.Author: LilyBritinDalyan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn for one night on our way home from the Far East. Ok it isn't in the centre of the city but it is so easy to use the tram outside to reach all the sights [1.5tl about 50 cents]. We had a room at the front and were not at all disturbed by noise. The room was small but adequate and extremely comfortable but the bathroom was the star. It was completely white and immaculately clean [it actually looked as if no-one had ever used it] full of freebies, which was great as I didn't have any. The other reason we booked at the Holiday Inn is that they have a smoking floor - this is allowed under the no smoking laws of Turkey however many hotels have not instituted this and we had an incredibly bad experience at the Pierre Loti when they tried to tell us that smoking in your hotel room was against the law!!!!! Minibar and breakfast expensive but plenty of simit houses a couple of minutes down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JDS9
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located next to a tram station and can be reached easily from the International Airport via the tram service. Its also about a 20 min ride to the part of town with major tourist attractions (blue mosque etc). There are a few local supermarkets within walking distance for you to stock up on daily water and other supplies. The rooms were clean but slightly on the smaller side. Our room faced the main room (and the tram station), but this did not bother us much as little noise managed to get in through the thick glass windows. The pool area was decent. All in all, good value for money - you pay a little less for not being in the heart of town, but that works fine because of convenient location near the tram station.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: maria_c79
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and it was good value for money (costed 100 euros/night without breakfast). I'd say it's rather a good 4star hotel and not a 5 star. Our room was spacious and comfortable, with a variety of pillows to choose. I didn't like the really expensive minibar so we chose to buy a bottle of water from a gasoline station just outside the hotel for 3 times less money. It is far from the city center but it's great advantage is the tram stop just outside the hotel, so we enjoyed many tram journeys and it was really nice. The free parking space outside the hotel is a plus, as we arrived by car. I had a nice stay but next time I'll choose a hotel near Taksim, i think it's the best area to stay.

Reviews.Title: “All round excellence”
Reviews.Author: Doolali
Reviews.Content: Why is it people write reviews when they only have bad comments to make? We were a party of 4 plus one baby and had a deal for 5 days 4 nights. It's location is great - not central yet 20 mins from Sultanamet. The tram station is just opposite and runs up to midnight. It costs 1.50TLR for a token which can be bought from a booth a few steps from the hotel. A selection of banks/local shops/supermarkets/cafes/eateries can be found in Capa which is only 300 meters away - about a 10 minute leisurely walk. We were mostly out sightseeing all day and were glad to come back to a nice quiet location. The rooms were big and cleaned daily, fresh towels provided on a daily basis and the bathroom had a bath/shower which worked great. Breakfast was amazing, really spoilt for choice and everything freshly prepared. The staff couldn't do enough for us and even for the baby, service was faultless. In fact everything was perfect and we didn't hear anyone else complain. One night my sister and brother-in-law ate at the Inn and said that the portions were large and really tasty albeit pricey - but hey, they have to make the money somehow! Our trip was great value for money and highly recommend this Inn. If you want central location then Sultanamet would be right for you or if you want nightlife then look at Taksim Sq area such as Istiklal or Nevizade. Location, service, rooms, food were excellent and no complaints from us.

Reviews.Title: “You should do better”
Reviews.Author: EarlRosebery
Reviews.Content: G20 finance meeting was on so city was packed. This is too far away although the tram (crowded and hot) will get you to Blue Mosque in 20 mins for next to nothing. I enjoyed the pool, We had an enormous room with a crazy bathroom. You had to leap about 2 feet high to get into the shower. Others in our party had rooms that were so damp their clothes were soaked. Room service pizza and a beers, Room for 2 nights and very decent breakfast (all you can eat) set us back 280 Euros (about US$ 420.)

Reviews.Title: “You Will be Much Happier ANYWHERE else”
Reviews.Author: FarRoamer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is barely inside the city gates, which is the middle of nowhere (20 minutes by Tram or 30 minutes by Taxi from the Old Historic Center where everything is. Rooms stunk of mildew, walpaper peeling in the halls, Outragously noisy in the front room and tolerable in the back rooms. The restaurant tries to be European/american gourmet but is way overpriced for the quality and taste. No other reataurants could easily be found around there. Worst Holiday Inn I've ever been to, and I've seen some bad ones. If someone would have slit my throat I'd have gurgled out a thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: taffyfrog
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to have a suite with 2 rooms and a bathroom. The only strange thing about it was that we had an enormous jacuzzi and shower in the bedroom. I sampled the hammam and had the scrub and soap treatment which were excellent. The hammam is mixed so the lady who gave me the treatment had to lock the door for part of the treatment. The best thing about the location is that the tram stops outside the hotel and for 1.50TL you are in the centre of the old part in no time at all. Meals and drinks in the hotel are very expensive, we found lots of small restaurants and shops a short walk down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not so good location”
Reviews.Author: Eldik
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 20 minutes away from the airport on one of the main tram route in Istanbul. But basically it is in the middle of nowhere, there is nothing to do around it. The closest place to eat something (besides the hotel restaurant) is about 500 meters away and you can buy water and sweets across the street in the gas station. Beside the location, the front desk people were kind, helpful and the room (I was upgraded to a suit) was big, clean, modern and with a big Jacuzzi. They told me that they just finished renovating it a few months ago. There was one strange thing about the room... a switch light that when I turned it on... lights started flashing in blue and red...hmmmm.... More in the hotel: Very nice swimming pool! I would stay longer in that hotel if my work place was close to it â€“ so if you donâ€™t want to be in the crowded center and you want a good and clean hotel go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5* but very good anyhow”
Reviews.Author: slimshaneylondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been rated 5* on some sites. It is not a 5*. it is a nice hotel, location is very good & staff are generally very good. I stayed for 6 nights on business. I liked that the tram stop was directly outside so it made getting around Istanbul very easy. Taxi's are expensive there so it's best to travel this way. You can take the train from the airport & connect to the tram very easily. The pool area is nice. The hotel was very clean. No problem with the room except the volume on the tv was a bit of a pain. Would recommend staying here if you get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Well connected”
Reviews.Author: ROCKYPRO
Reviews.Content: My exprience with this hotel was wonderful. During my honeymoon in turkey I stayed there for last night. I later regretted the stay was only for just one day. The pool & spa was amazing. This hotel is well connected through the tram service. It is right opposite tram station & tram takes you to , Grand Bazar, Spice Market, Blue Mosque, Istikal Street, Ortakoy...These are must see places and they are well connected through tram service. As it is within city generally you will find big traffic jams and the tram service is best solution. It is just ard 30 mins from airport and 30 mins from istikal street which is very popular among tourist . I will highly recommend this place it costed us 150 USD per night inclusive of breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A Disaster for the Price”
Reviews.Author: emandernie
Reviews.Content: The one good thing was the check-in; pleasant, quick and they allowed us an early check-in as well. But their claims they renovated in 2003 don't apply to the no smoking floor I guess as rooms are tiny, central air/heat doesn't work, TV is ancient and sound was awful (they couldn't fix it), and every time you showered you got hit with both scalding and freezing water. They say don't drink the water but don't provide anything for the customer which is not normal in these places. The steam room has been broken "for some time" and the gym is old (what about this renovation). They call themselves a 5 star - I am amazed they can keep the Holiday Inn name. $20 for a pizza and $7 for half a beer is rich for this part of town. Being close to the tram was nice but it also meant you had to listen to the traffic as you are right on the main road. There are cheaper and better hotels in the city center that include breakfast - this place wanted $19 - fine for a real 5 star but this one barely hits 2. I must credit the front desk for trying to make this best of a bad situation although their solution to most questions was to take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Never go there”
Reviews.Author: lav2008
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in this hotel during a Business Visit to Istanbul. We were a group of 5 who stayed in the hotel and all of us have the same opinoin. When we checked in there was no mention about advance amount or something. One fine day they blocked our rooms saying we have not done any payment and we had reached their limits. The staff here were very rude, during breakfast their only aim was to clean the table and not wait for the guest to complete eating.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: RKBLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and although the hotel claims to be a 5 star the service we received was anything but high. #Negatives -20/30mins away from the main tourist areas and requires a tram or taxi ride to get to them. Therefore, in bit of a dead area of Istanbul. - Poor security and surveillance led to our bag being stolen by the poolside of the hotel in broad daylight. The management in the hotel were extremely rude and unhelpful and infact tried to put the blame on us! - Very few members of staff spoke English therefore adding to our frustrations. - Obtaining items for our rooms took several phone calls and requests. - The cost of the food and water in the hotel is inflated beyond belief. A small bottle of Evian for Â£5! (Go across the road to the Shell station and buy a big bottle for 50p). #Positives - Tram station right outside the hotel to take you to main destinations at a small sum of 1lira 40 - about 65p. - The rooms were clean and generally had most facilities although they were quite crampt. - Probably one of the cheaper hotels around in an otherwise expensive city, but ultimately you get what you pay for. We visited the Four seasons in Sultan Hamet and all I can say is Wow. Wish we had spent a bit more money and stayed in a hotel where we would have been treated with such a high standard of service. If you are economising this is the hotel for you. However, if you are after 5 star treatment, I suggest you go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but pricey, generic and see-through bathroom is disturbing!”
Reviews.Author: sachahuista
Reviews.Content: I didn't pay to stay at the Holiday Inn because I'd accumulated enough points - and thank goodness for that! It's pricey - very pricey for its location which, albeit central and nice, isn't exactly in the centre and a taxi home at night from the other side of Galata Bridge is going to cost you 20 Turkish liras. That said, its location is very handy for the tram - it's right outside - for the city centre heading East (20 mins to the Blue Mosque but it can be very crowded), or going west towards the airport via the tram (last stop) and the metro all the way to Ataturk International Airport. Use them or you'll be stuck in the horrendous traffic. They do have a pick-up service from the airport if you contact them ahead. I did - but no one picked me up, so metro and tram it was for me - 40 minutes away. The hotel is very modern, and the room I was in - just a normal guestroom - is huge! Massive bed, mini-living room with widescreen TV and satellite channels, in-room safe (though mine broke down), dining table, desk and very helpful staff. I couldn't quite work out how to use the automatic toilet which was pointless - but the worst aspect was an open bath/shower - right in the middle of the bedroom! It was a very nice shower but if you're staying with a colleague, be prepared for lots of awkward moments! Maybe just my room but no hiding there! I didn't try the breakfast - looks ok but at 12 euros it wasn't worth the money. Internet wasn't free, and the in-room wifi was either. Also, it's close to a mosque so morning prayers will wake you up! I would have no problem recommending someone staying here though there are plenty of cheaper options closer to town and more traditional than this generic type of accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: Angun
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice and comfortable, the room clean and silent (except when the muezzin prayed!). We also tried the hammam and it has been a wonderful experience, it was all for the two of us, free of charce. The only thing we regretted was being massaged (painful!), but if you go there not asking for treatments, you'll be OK. The staff are really helpful, polite and friendly. It was good and cheap as we got a very good price fron the hotel website, but a little far from the centre of the city, although the tram stop was just across the street. I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice, good value”
Reviews.Author: kyushuman
Reviews.Content: I think it's hard to wholeheartedly recommend this hotel because it doesn't seem as "polished" as HIs in Europe can be. But there are some big pros as well: PROS: 1) Great location for someone like me--I don't want to be out at the airport hotels, but I also don't want to take an hour to get to and from my hotel (anything on Taksim side, or even downtown like in Sultanhamet can be a long drive due to horrific traffic) 2) Tramway in front of hotel takes you to Sultanhamet and Eminonou within 20 minutes, for 1.3 Turkish Lira. Also the Tramway connects to the subway system to and from the airport, though this option doesn't exist late at night. 3) Nice breakfast--olives, cheeses, fruits, omelet station, breads, hot savouries, and juices/coffees. If included in the rate, it's a nice way to start the day. Otherwise, I think it's really expensive. 4) Friendly, though not so polished, service. Staff seems to be experienced and helpful when they can be. 5) Very clean rooms. 6) Surprisingly nice pool area, with grasses and lounge chairs. Newish "mini-gym", with a few cardio and nautilus equipment, though nothing special. CONS: 1) Location isn't really walking distance to much. 2) Restaurant and room service are bafflingly expensive and not the best quality for dinner. 3) Front Desk didn't know the rate included breakfast; I don't like to be forced to "prove" I have breakfast included--I booked through the hotel's own web site! 4) Room was just OK--nice big plasma TV, oldish beds that were comfy but not the best quality linens, etc. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel if it's still cheaper than in-town places. I am the kind of traveller who doesn't enjoy mom and pop hotels/ B&Bs where you can hear your neighbors coming and going, and the staff knows all of your business. Some like that kind of place, if so then the HI isn't for you. I'd stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose it”
Reviews.Author: Fosseboy
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research and chose this for location... The tram was great...stopped outside and took us to all the key sights. Just hide your wallet on the crowded tram...mine was pickpocketed in the crush. Easy to get to airport by tram and metro...and only 2,6 lira each. The hotel reception was friendly and gave good advice. Room was large, newly refurbished and clean. Breakfast excellent. Dinner however was poor on arrival night so we did not use restaurant again. I would not hesitate to return, Spa was good...excellent massage and advice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: olat
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice, clean and its in a great location. The staff were helpful and polite.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Istanbul City
HotelInfo.Address: Turgut Ozal Cad. (Millet Cad) | No:189 TopkapÄ±, Istanbul 34280, Turkey
